column4: I need to do some voice recording and tried to use the "sound recorder" but tells me my multimedia settings must be setup... How do I do that? Or is there a better program to use for this?
Can anybody recommend a good voice recorder or help me setup the one offered by Ubuntu?
What's the best way to voice record in here?
Do we have in Ubuntu anything like soundforge in xp?
hi all. Can anybody help? Just because Ubuntu offers bluetooth capability that does not necessarily mean that my computer does have bluetooth, does it?
that's correct
do you mean a video camcorder?
gyaresu, No, it is a voice digital recorder
if you're lucky, it works as a USB mass storage device. If not, you'll have to reverse-engineer the Windows drivers and write some for Linux.
assuming it does how do you set up as a mass storage device (though I doubt it)
mass storage devices mount automatically. Run 'tail -f /var/log/syslog' while you plug it in to find out what ubuntu does with the device. Compare to when you plug in a memory stick.
it's very unlikely to work. Drivers generally tie in closely with the OS kernel.
i see
But don't we have a recording device in Ubuntu I can use even if I have to sit at the computer while I do it.
do contact Panasonic about it as well. It won't help immediately, but it's good if they see that there is demand for Linux drivers.
I already did
if you can engage them in a dialogue, tell them that the community will write drivers for them if they publish the specifications.
that's a great idea
check out the topic of the channel #bash -- very valuable stuff there
audacity
I haven't tested sound recorder properly. Audacity is not pretty, but it has useful editing, level setting, mixing and other features
the topic of #bash also has very useful information
it's another IRC channel. Try /join #bash
I said read the topic
